title: What I think Bard needs changed on 5.6
body:
I think the biggest problem with Bard is clearly his lack of damage.  I think if his ult did SOME, not a lot, but just some amount of AOE damage it would be a great buff for him.  As a support main I picked this champ up quickly and like him a lot, but I don't know if he is viable in ranked.  I'm still practicing him, but I think unless he gets more buffs I won't use him in ranked when there are better picks, such as thresh, blitz, janna, sona.

Edit: Only does damage to enemy champs, not your teammates (Maybe even heal your teammates?!)

replies.body:
We'd like to keep Bard's ult damage free, since putting a damaging effect on it leads to some conflicting uses and muddies it's purpose (keep dudes out of a fight, whether allies safe or enemies unable to contribute).

We definitely agree Bard needs some buffs though. We held off from doing substantially changes in patch 5.6 since by the time the patch changes locked Bard had only been out for 6 days. That's not enough time to see how people adapt to and learn a new champ, and we've sometimes buffed champs unnecessarily in the past when we've reacted too quickly, so we decided to give it a bit more time. At this point we're confident he does need some more significant buffs though, and have a better idea of where to test out more power. You should see some buffs on the PBE in the next couple of days at a guess, with a focus on base stats, amount of mana restored per chime and faster Meep respawn. We're also planning to test a little tweaking to Chime spawn locations, though that's more speculative and might be more of a feel change than a power one, not sure yet.

Qs missile speed isn't that big of an issue tbh, Though i'd like it if bard had a better way of dealing with solo opponents who don't stand close enough to wall stun them.But between Slows for days and a miniature {{summoner:7}} , i'm willing to take the single target weakness.
I'd gladly trade Cast Range for Increased Missile Speed.
Maybe a better option would be to have it give a speed boost to allies and slow to enemies that get caught by it once it ends?

How about:

* Cosmic Binding 
 * Now applies a knockdown, similar to Event Horizon, Nether Grasp, etc. No longer can Rocket Jump stretch the chord a couple thousand units. You could go one further and have it also "yank" enemies in a fixed ranged of the anchor (this **wouldn't** apply "airborne", as with Gravity Field).
* Magical Journey
 * Quality of life change for Quick Casters: Magical Journey will now show range indicators by default (i.e. the ability goes off on-release instead of on-press). Using it on Quick Casting should feel similar to Varus/Vi/Xerath - you can hold the button down, line it up and then let it go. 
* Tempered Fate
 * New Passive: The number of Chimes spawned every 50 seconds is increased by 1 / 2 / 3 (total: 3 / 4 / 5). *This pushes the acquisition time of 150 to ~40 minutes down from ~60 minutes. The issue with Bard's passive at the moment is that compared to Thresh, Lulu, Sona, etc, with similar passives - they all reach level 18 long before his passive does anything close to comparable damage, even if he's also level 18.*

I followed the Q&A for Bard but I didn't see any response: how does Bard's Q actually work? When I read his reveal I always assumed "searches for secondary targets" was flavour-text and that the ability was functionally identical to Light Binding/Baleful Strike (and that's how its in-game tooltip implies)... however, I have seen a lot of instances where the tether goes off at odd angles to stick to walls (just yesterday I saw the tether hit a wall completely perpendicular to Bard/his target, as if he was playing Vel'Koz or something). Does the ability actually function like Double Up? Does it *actually* "search" for secondary targets if there's no-one behind them? 

If not, could that work as a tweak to the skill? A mini-Chain of Corruption. "Bard hurls a bolt of cosmic energy that connects with the first nemy it hits, dealing magic damage and slowing. A tendril then extends from the target to bind to a nearby enemy or nearby terrain." (There would be a maximum acquisition radius and slightly larger tether radius). Heck, you could make the tendril last a fixed length of time and continually try to find an anchor, so it adds an element of area of denial.

Don't know about the cosmic binding one, but maybe something similar, or if the spell only hits champions, it stuns if it hits terrain or other units, but it tethers to a fixed point if it doesn't, stopping the enemy chasing, but giving them options to escape, maintaining Bards non aggressive kit.

I suggested a similar passive on E, but I guess it could work on R. Maybe instead, Chimes spawn more often with E, but meeps spawn more often with R?

One of the complaints a friend of mine always has about Bard is how little experience the chimes give. Even when his roams are successful, Bard still ends up underleveled compared to what he'd be at if he had not roamed.

> [{quoted}](name=Meddler,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=zYt4k2eI,comment-id=0006,timestamp=2015-03-27T06:56:49.798+0000)

We're also planning to test a little tweaking to Chime spawn locations, though that's more speculative and might be more of a feel change than a power one, not sure yet.

These are the buffs I would personally like to see: 

(1) **Slightly faster Meep respawn during laning**. Bard currently has an extremely low threat potential in the early laning phase (which is exacerbated by the lack of any offensive power spike when he grabs his W and E). I'm fine with him having a lower threat potential than other supports (because of his utility) but it feels a bit too low in his current state. The Meep respawn rate doesn't feel like much of an issue once laning's over, because you're able to carry multiple Meeps and skirmishes don't usually happen that quick in succession.

(2) **Adjusted Meep spawn locations during laning**. I've noticed that Meeps will often spawn based on your location and position relative to the river. This has led to some very difficult Meep spawns in the first five minutes in the game, especially if I'm scouting for jungle invades. This (usually) makes me hit my first few passive levels later, which makes laning much more difficult because of how important the first few passive levels are. I've actually found myself often waiting by the T2 tower to make sure the first two Meep clusters spawn in favorable locations, which is not really helpful for my jungler and team.

(3) **Adjust Bard's Q targeting slightly**. I'm not quite sure if Bard's Q is just a straight skillshot, or the second tether has some targeting algorithm (similar to Miss Fortune's Q), but I've had some occasions where I manage to tether a second target that I didn't want (usually a minion) when I thought I was aiming Bard's Q at a different target and angle. This isn't a huge issue, and doesn't happen frequently, but it's surprising and disappointing when it happens. I think his Q is fine otherwise. 

(4) **Adjust Bard's ult speed slightly**. I'd like Bard's ult speed to be increased just a little bit (~.25 seconds) and his ult indicator (to allies and enemies) be adjusted proportionately. I've been able to do some very interesting and exciting plays with his ult, but it currently feels a bit more unreliable than it should be, especially with its higher cooldown.

The other buffs you've mentioned (base stats, mana per chime) are nice, but I don't feel like they're much of an issue. I feel like Bard's base stats are comparable to other supports in lane (especially after runes) and I think that Bard is appropriately punished for spamming his heal in lane (he doesn't have mana issues otherwise).

His ult dealing AOE damage is a pretty nonsensical buff. Considering you're a support who isn't building damage this won't even do much for him. Think of Janna's tornado for instance. Do people use it for a disengage/knockup or do people use it for the damage? If the damage was taken off of Janna's tornado, not much would have changed on her and people would still pick her. Also think of Nami's ultimate. Same situation here. If you took the damage off of her ultimate, people would still pick her. Her ultimate's damage is not what makes it strong. If you put base damage enough on bard's ult for it to be significant then it'd be OP.

There are 2 options I think bard needs in order to be completely viable:
1.) he has to be tankier. Higher base HP and health per level stats. His Q is short ranged and requires him to be put in a dangerous position. Throwing a meep also requires him to get in a bad position.
2.) His Q needs to be more reliable. It's a very slow skillshot and very short ranged. Either the speed needs to be faster or the range needs to be longer. I don't think it'd be too much to ask if he had Morgana Q range. Either that or the skillshot should be as fast as Elise's stun. If they are going to make him so squishy, they need to make his CC easier to land.

One of these two buffs need to happen and that would put him in a relatively good place.

I feel like Bard's identity is in roaming (regardless of how effective he really is at it). Each one of his abilities is conducive to a roaming playstyle.

* Q is akin to Annie/Morgana/Thresh style roaming where you make picks in mid-lane when your ADC has frozen lane in a safe position.
* W brings map-wide sustain for the laning phase. Soraka somewhat fits this, but Bard's mobility actually allows him to do so in a faster amount of time.
* E facilitates more effective jungler ganks.
* R range allows you to make long-range clutch ults when you are warding/collecting chimes.

Q range or missile speed definitely needs to be looked at, but I feel like his W should be given higher priority. His W feels lackluster and for a support whose hard CC is very conditional, it needs to be bumped up to be just a level below Soraka's sustain potential instead of a high cost low heal.

I've started a poll to ask whether a bard buff should focus on his "roaming" "tankiness" or "Power", personally I think improving his cc and roaming would be best, but I think making him tankier is a nice alternative
